Notes: The USA Archives originated in 1978 as the Photographic Archives.  Collections include holdings of approximately 500,000 photographic negatives produced by Eric Overbey and other local photographers.  Current collecting focuses upon visual and written material on Mobile, southern Alabama, and records of the University of South Alabama.  Manuscript holdings total approximately 3,500 cubic feet and include court records of the Thirteenth Judicial Circuit, c. 1830 to 1917; records of the Gulf, Mobile, and Ohio Railroad; papers of Congressman Jack Edwards; local government publications; maps; and city directories.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
